section.title: Build.jar
section.p: Build.jar is a Java program that allows you to change project settings, test your visual novel, and create a packaged version for distribution.

section.title: Preferences
section.p: There are several types of config/preference files that can be edited to customize your visual novel. Build.jar groups all these together into one big table with descriptions for each setting. It also has a basic/advanced mode toggle that hides less relevant settings.

section.title: Rebuild
section.p: (Re)creates the launcher scripts/executables required to test your visual novel. It's sometimes necessary to do a rebuild after changing files in build-res from outside Build.jar, or after updating NVList to a new version.

If your Java installation is a JRE (Java runtime) and not a full JDK (Java devkit), the build system will give you the warning unable to locate tools.jar. It's safe to ignore this warning unless you're extending the engine itself with additional Java code (requires a JDK).

section.title: Edit
section.p: Opens the project script folder in a file browser.

section.title: Backup
section.p: Creates a backup copy of your script folder. The scripts are stored as bak/script/script-$DATE.zip.

section.title: Run Game
section.p: Starts NVList to test your visual novel.

section.title: Resource Optimizer
section.p: Starts the resource optimizer. See: Resource Optimizer

section.title: Create Applet
section.p: Creates an applet distribution for embedding into a webpage. See: Creating a Distribution

section.title: Create Release
section.p: Packages your project and NVList files together ready for end-user distribution. See: Creating a Distribution

section.title: Create CD Release
section.p: Creates a disk image (.iso) ready to burn onto a CD/DVD. See: Creating a Distribution

section.title: Create Android Project
section.p: Opens the Android build config window for creating a port of your project to the Android operating system. See: Releasing on Android
